Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk koan
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: Red Hat Network Tools rhncfg and koan bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: Red Hat Network Tools provide programs and libraries that allow your system to use provisioning, monitoring, and configuration management capabilities provided by Red Hat Network and Red Hat Network Satellite. This update fixes the following bugs: Prior to this update, running the "rhncfg-client verify" command did not remove temporary files when command failed. This bug has been fixed and running "rhncfg-client verify" now always removes temporary files. (BZ#518128) Prior to this update, running the "rhncfg-client" command did not work correctly on FIPS enabled system. This bug has been fixed and "rhncfg-client" now works as expected. (BZ#1238769) Prior to this update, kickstarting a Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 s390x system with Red Hat Satellite did not work correctly due to unsupported format of some kernel parameters. This bug has been fixed and kickstart now works as expected. (BZ#1270676) Users of Red Hat Network Tools are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
